alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 8:14PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CRAIG... NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE AND OTTAWA COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM CDT... At 814 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Afton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Miami... Fairland... Afton... Bluejacket... Wyandotte... Narcissa... Ottawa... Peoria... Twin Bridges State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 287 and 309. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
